thread.title: Dolan says MSG banning Oakley after arrest at Knicks game
thread.title_full: Dolan says MSG banning Oakley after arrest at Knicks game

author: MSN Money
title: Dolan says MSG banning Oakley after arrest at Knicks game

organizations.name: associated press madison square garden executive

text:
Dolan says MSG banning Oakley after arrest at Knicks game Associated Press 58 mins ago Replay Video SETTINGS OFF HD HQ SD LO NEW YORK — Madison Square Garden chairman James Dolan says Charles Oakley has been banned from the arena, though not necessarily forever.
In an interview Friday with ESPN Radio's Michael Kay, Dolan also confirms a report that he had fired the Garden's security chief, two nights after Oakley was forcefully removed from his seat and arrested at a Knicks game. Dolan says the firing of the security head stemmed from more than just the handling of the Oakley incident.
Dolan says that games must remain safe for fans, and for that reason, "We are going to put the ban in place and hopefully it won't be forever."
The Knicks distributed a witness report earlier Friday featuring more than a dozen witnesses from throughout the arena who described what the Knicks have called Oakley's "abusive" behavior.
© The Associated Press Madison Square Garden Executive Chairman James Dolan reacts to an altercation between the Charles Oakley and security guards during the first half of an NBA basketball game between the New York Knicks and the LA Clippers, Wednesday, Feb. 8, 2017, in New York. (AP Photo/Frank Franklin II) Go to MSN Home
